intro: Tulasnea pedunculata, commonly known as the redstem tulasnean, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Tulasnea pedunculata thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
